text: * Chapter 1 Chapter 1{{{1 1.
Name: Book 2

text: The two brothers were almost to the wall when the skulls flew overhead.
Name: Book 2

text: Make them stop.
Name: Book 2

text: cried Harruq Tun, hands pressed against his ears.
Name: Book 2

text: Beside him, Qurrah Tun stood mesmerized by the sight.
Name: Book 2

text: Hundreds of skulls bathed in purple fire sailed over the walls of Veldaren like dark comets.
Name: Book 2

text: Gaping mouths shrieked mindless wails, their voices bone-chilling and unrelenting.
Name: Book 2

text: A few soldiers fired arrows, but most hid behind their shields.
Name: Book 2

text: Why do you cower.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah asked, striking his brother on the shoulder.
Name: Book 2

text: The skulls are nuisances, nothing more.
Name: Book 2

text: He shivered as a skull sailed just above them, its screech turning to chaotic laughter.
Name: Book 2

text: The sound raced up and down his spine, triggering fear no matter how irrational.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah watched as if immune to the sound.
Name: Book 2

text: He was so much smaller than Harruq, his slender body wrapped in rags, thin flesh clinging to bone.
Name: Book 2

text: Yet he was unafraid.
Name: Book 2

text: Shame and embarrassment burned in Harruqs cheeks.
Name: Book 2

text: He towered over his brother, his hands beefy and arms muscular.
Name: Book 2

text: Nothing should scare him.
Name: Book 2

text: He was supposed to be Qurrahs protector, not the other way around.
Name: Book 2

text: Where can we climb.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq asked, hoping to get his mind off the skulls.
Name: Book 2

text: A narrow set of stairs climbed to the parapet and Harruq led the way.
Name: Book 2

text: The city gates were lost in the distance, city guards clustered about them.
Name: Book 2

text: He spoke the word with an odd reverence, but they both understood its significance.
Name: Book 2

text: Unlike the humans, the two brothers skin was dark and tinged with gray, their ears long and curled to a point.
Name: Book 2

text: They were half-orcs, condemned for the tainted blood coursing through their veins.
Name: Book 2

text: The people of Veldaren hurled the word at them like a dagger, but in truth neither had ever seen a full orc before.
Name: Book 2

text: Now well finally see, Qurrah said, what we are, what we are meant to be.
Name: Book 2

text: Thousands of orcs spilled into the west, needing no light to see in the darkness.
Name: Book 2

text: They howled and cheered, drums and war chants mixing with the shrieks of the skulls.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq felt his temples throb.
Name: Book 2

text: A wail rolled over him as a deathly comet swirled about, spotting the two and eying them like prey.
Name: Book 2

text: Try as he might, he couldnt stop from shaking.
Name: Book 2

text: Can you stop them.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq asked, squinting at the sky.
Name: Book 2

text: Perhaps, said Qurrah, eyes distant and unfocused.
Name: Book 2

text: But orcs dont use necromancy, not if the stories Ive heard are true.
Name: Book 2

text: Someone else travels with themsomeone who must be strong.
Name: Book 2

text: When it comes to this mind stuff, no ones stronger than you.
Name: Book 2

text: He closed his eyes, letting his mind sink into the ether.
Name: Book 2

text: Like scent to a bloodhound, Qurrah could sense the magic flowing all about him.
Name: Book 2

text: The flame surrounding the skulls flared even brighter, but beneath their tails trailed long threads of silver.
Name: Book 2

text: When Qurrah looked up, he saw hundreds of the threads twisting and curling together, coiling toward a hidden presence deep within the orc army.
Name: Book 2

text: Taking in a deep breath, Qurrah pooled his strength and focused on the skull taunting his brother, visualizing the thread and seeking to sever it.
Name: Book 2

text: There was a pull on his chestthe taste of copper on his tongue.
Name: Book 2

text: When he opened his eyes, the skull fell to the battlements.
Name: Book 2

text: The jaw snapped and rotting teeth clattered to the streets below.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq picked up the skull, frowning at its ordinariness.
Name: Book 2

text: Shrugging, he flung it toward the distant army of orcs.
Name: Book 2

text: Not done yet, Qurrah said, sweat lining his face, his breathing soft and ragged.
Name: Book 2

text: He closed his eyes.
Name: Book 2

text: This time, he didnt grab just one thread.
Name: Book 2

text: He grabbed them all.
Name: Book 2

text: They screeched and twisted in his grip.
Name: Book 2

text: His head pounded, and the pull on his chest was so great he felt he might pitch over the wall to his death.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrahs well of magic drained at frightening speed.
Name: Book 2

text: He almost let go, but he thought of his brother, shaking under the spell of the skulls.
Name: Book 2

text: He clutched tighter, the threads braiding into a giant rope in his mind.
Name: Book 2

text: High above, the skulls quieted, and their fires dimmed.
Name: Book 2

text: When the necromancer noticed Qurrahs meddling, his mental link pulsed with incredible energy.
Name: Book 2

text: Colors swarmed through his mind, dark purples and reds across a macabre canvas of black.
Name: Book 2

text: He felt his chest tightening, his neck constricting.
Name: Book 2

text: A scrying eye was upon him, now, and he was losing.
Name: Book 2

text: It felt like an arrow pierced his mind, and through it words seeped into his head.
Name: Book 2

text: An apparition swirled before him, blacker than the shadows, red eyes smoldering.
Name: Book 2

text: Its rank claws touched his face, turning the sweat on his brow to ice.
Name: Book 2

text: The arrow squirmed deeper.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah focused every bit of his will upon it, desperately seeking to repulse it.
Name: Book 2

text: His well of energy, which hed thought empty, burgeoned and over-flowed.
Name: Book 2

text: The arrow snapped, banishing the necromancers presence, but leaving a solitary impression squatting at the back of Qurrahs mind:.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah opened his eyes.
Name: Book 2

text: He lay on his back in his brothers arms, yet he didnt remember falling.
Name: Book 2

text: He lost, he said, pointing to the night sky.
Name: Book 2

text: And he doesnt know how badly.
Name: Book 2

text: One by one, the skulls fire went out and they fell like morbid hail upon the city.
Name: Book 2

text: Limitless, Qurrah said, his smile trembling.
Name: Book 2

text: Blood ran from his nose, and his skin was so pale Harruq could see his veins.
Name: Book 2

text: The well is limitless.
Name: Book 2

text: His eyes rolled into his head.
Name: Book 2

text: Without another word, he collapsed.
Name: Book 2

text: He dreamt of fire poured into flesh and a man whose eyes were glass.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq shouted when his brother finally opened his eyes.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah asked as he lurched onto his feet.
Name: Book 2

text: Not long, Harruq said, holding Qurrahs shoulder to steady him.
Name: Book 2

text: The orcs are almost here.
Name: Book 2

text: As if on cue, they heard a collective roar from the south.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq glanced at the stairs along the wall, but Qurrah saw this and shook his head.
Name: Book 2

text: We need to get closer to the fight, Qurrah said, slurring his words.
Name: Book 2

text: I need to see him.
Name: Book 2

text: Sure thing, Harruq agreed.
Name: Book 2

text: I have an idea.
Name: Book 2

text: He grabbed Qurrahs arm and hooked his elbow around it.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah was too weak to complain, so together they ran down the streets.
Name: Book 2

text: They passed closed homes containing people praying for safety and victory.
Name: Book 2

text: Looming ahead of them was the southern gate.
Name: Book 2

text: Hundreds of soldiers stacked against it, their shields braced and ready.
Name: Book 2

text: All along the walls, archers released arrow after arrow into the darkness.
Name: Book 2

text: How are we to get closer.
Name: Book 2

text: Ignore them, Harruq said.
Name: Book 2

text: I know what Im doing.
Name: Book 2

text: He led them into an alley in between several worn buildings made of stone.
Name: Book 2

text: He stopped just before the next set of homes, for he heard talking.
Name: Book 2

text: Holding Qurrah back, he peered around the corner to find a soldier dressed in finely polished armor raising his sword in salute.
Name: Book 2

text: At first Harruq did not see who he saluted, but an elf fell from the roof and landed before the soldier.
Name: Book 2

text: An elf, Harruq whispered, managing to grab Qurrahs attention.
Name: Book 2

text: Now both peered around the corner, curious why such an exotic creature had arrived mere seconds before war.
Name: Book 2

text: Greetings, Dieredon, the soldier hailed, pulling off his helmet.
Name: Book 2

text: He was a middle-aged, blond-haired man who had numerous scars on his face.
Name: Book 2

text: Greetings to you as well, guard captain Antonil, Dieredon said, taking a step back and kneeling.
Name: Book 2

text: Though I fear greetings is all I may offer you.
Name: Book 2

text: Antonil pointed to the wall, and he asked something which neither could hear when the orc army shouted another communal roar.
Name: Book 2

text: The Ekreissar will not aid you, Dieredon said when the noise died.
Name: Book 2

text: He shook his head, and a bit of sadness crossed his face.
Name: Book 2

text: We have been forbidden.
Name: Book 2

text: Ceredon insists this is a minor skirmish, nothing more.
Name: Book 2

text: We are not the keepers of man.
Name: Book 2

text: What about the necromancer traveling with them.
Name: Book 2

text: Youre the one who said he was dangerous, that he might be.
Name: Book 2

text: Another communal roar, even closer.
Name: Book 2

text: I know, Dieredon glared.
Name: Book 2

text: I will watch, and I will pray.
Name: Book 2

text: Whoever started this war will not go unpunished.
Name: Book 2

text: The elf whistled, and to the brothers surprise a winged horse landed on the rooftop of a nearby home.
Name: Book 2

text: Its skin and mane were sparkling white.
Name: Book 2

text: Dieredon bowed one last time and then leapt into the air, using the ledge of a window to swing himself onto the roof.
Name: Book 2

text: He mounted his horse, patted her side, and then took off into the night.
Name: Book 2

text: Antonil shouted, slamming his mailed fist into the wall.
Name: Book 2

text: Still shaking his head, he stormed back to the gate, muttering curses.
Name: Book 2

text: What was that all about.
Name: Book 2

text: King Vaelor asked for aid and the elves declined, Qurrah answered, chuckling.
Name: Book 2

text: The Kings pride will not take too kindly to that.
Name: Book 2

text: He and his pride can suck a rotten egg, Harruq said.
Name: Book 2

text: Hurry or well miss the battle.
Name: Book 2

text: He pulled his brother down the alley to where a tall, crumbled house leaned near the wall.
Name: Book 2

text: Onto my shoulders, Harruq suggested, grabbing Qurrahs knees and hoisting him high.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah latched onto the roof, paused, and then stepped onto Harruqs shoulders.
Name: Book 2

text: The extra height boosted his head and chest above the roof, allowing him to climb to the top despite a moment of flailing.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq clapped for him, and he smiled at the next roar from the orcs.
Name: Book 2

text: It was a goofy smile, and Qurrah recognized the fear hiding behind it.
Name: Book 2

text: Hurry, Qurrah said as Harruq climbed, using a windowsill as a foothold.
Name: Book 2

text: Together, they stood upon the roof and gazed over the wall, mesmerized by the sight before them.
Name: Book 2

text: Mere seconds away, hundreds and hundreds of orcs charged.
Name: Book 2

text: Their race could see as well in night as in day.
Name: Book 2

text: That same racial ability allowed the two brothers to watch the approaching orcs, lean muscle bulging underneath their sweat-glistened pale gray skin.
Name: Book 2

text: Some wore mismatched armor, though most had only skulls, straps of leather, and war paint covering their bodies.
Name: Book 2

text: Wave after wave of arrows rained upon them, and those who fell were trampled by the rest, but the masses were not even slowed.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq pointed past the army to where a long line of men stood in the distance, carrying no light or torch.
Name: Book 2

text: What are they doing.
Name: Book 2

text: he asked.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah searched the line, and he saw what he suspected.
Name: Book 2

text: The necromancer, he observed, pointing to the black shape hidden underneath robes and a hood.
Name: Book 2

text: Those alongside him are dead, Harruq.
Name: Book 2

text: They serve only him.
Name: Book 2

text: Lot of good hes doing.
Name: Book 2

text: How are the orcs going to get through the wall, they have nothing but.
Name: Book 2

text: The man in black robes lifted his hand.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah saw pale and bony fingers hooked in strange formations.
Name: Book 2

text: Then came the fire, erupting as if those fingers were a crack releasing the melted rock of the abyss.
Name: Book 2

text: The sudden light blinded them both.
Name: Book 2

text: The fire burned through the orcs as a solid beam, melting their bodies and scattering their remains.
Name: Book 2

text: When it struck the wooden gate, it exploded.
Name: Book 2

text: Guards behind the gate howled as molten rock struck them, piercing through their shields and armor.
Name: Book 2

text: The orcs roared at the sight, not at all upset at their own losses.
Name: Book 2

text: The way into the city was clear.
Name: Book 2

text: Axes and swords held high, they rushed the opening.
Name: Book 2

text: A minor skirmish, Qurrah chuckled, echoing the elfs words.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq had anticipated watching the fight over the wall from the roof, but instead they turned and watched the orcs slam into the human forces that surrounded the opening.
Name: Book 2

text: The first push was brutal.
Name: Book 2

text: Screams of pain and the sound of clashing of metal on metal flowed into the city.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq watched an orc wielding two swords cut off the arm of one soldier, and, as the blood from the limb splattered across his face, he turned and decapitated another with two vicious hacks.
Name: Book 2

text: The orc roared in victory only to die as a soldier shoved his sword in his side and out his back.
Name: Book 2

text: Will they make it through.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq asked, in awe of the display.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah glanced over the wall and then back to the main combat.
Name: Book 2

text: Archers continued eviscerating the orc forces.
Name: Book 2

text: If they could push into the city, their arrows would be a nuisance at best, but it seemed they had underestimated the human soldiers.
Name: Book 2

text: They are running out of time, Qurrah said.
Name: Book 2

text: He glanced back to the necromancer, and then he saw his eyes, just hints of red underneath the hood of his robes.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah shivered as whispers shot up his spine.
Name: Book 2

text: You silenced my pets,  it said.
Name: Book 2

text: I do as I wish, Qurrah whispered back.
Name: Book 2

text: He felt a touch of cold on his fingers, like the fleeting kiss of a corpse lover.
Name: Book 2

text: You ally with the city of men.
Name: Book 2

text: Again, I do as I wish, Qurrah whispered.
Name: Book 2

text: Who are you talking to.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah, whats going on.
Name: Book 2

text: He tore his gaze back to the fight.
Name: Book 2

text: More orcs had pushed inward, leaving them bunched in a wide circle.
Name: Book 2

text: They flung themselves against the surrounding guards.
Name: Book 2

text: Again he felt a cold chill, this time creeping across his arms like frost spiders.
Name: Book 2

text: The sensation of being watched was unbearable.
Name: Book 2

text: We need to move, he said.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 2

text: If the guards falter we might suffer.
Name: Book 2

text: Were already high up, Harruq said.
Name: Book 2

text: He doubled over, hacking and coughing.
Name: Book 2

text: His breath was raspy and weak.
Name: Book 2

text: Take me from the wall.
Name: Book 2

text: Alright then, Harruq said, grabbing his brothers arm.
Name: Book 2

text: He leapt off the roof, pulling Qurrah with him.
Name: Book 2

text: As his feet smacked the hard ground, his knees buckled and he fell back, catching his brother as he did.
Name: Book 2

text: Without a word of thanks, Qurrah stepped off him and leaned against the wall.
Name: Book 2

text: His whole body shuddered.
Name: Book 2

text: He had often looked into the darkness.
Name: Book 2

text: For the first time, the darkness had looked back, and it was amused.
Name: Book 2

text: Whoever this necromancer was, Qurrah knew he had been an idiot to challenge him.
Name: Book 2

text: Lead the way, Qurrah said.
Name: Book 2

text: And forgive my outburst.
Name: Book 2

text: I understand, Harruq said, ignoring the pain in his knees and the bit of blood running from his elbow to his wrist.
Name: Book 2

text: We need to hurry, though.
Name: Book 2

text: He looped his arm through Qurrahs and then hurried down the alley.
Name: Book 2

text: As a soldiers body collapsed at the end, the two stopped, and Harruq swore.
Name: Book 2

text: The orcs made it through, he said, to which Qurrah nodded.
Name: Book 2

text: This could be bad.
Name: Book 2

text: An orc stepped into the alley, blood splashed across his gray skin.
Name: Book 2

text: He held a sword in each hand, dripping gore coating both.
Name: Book 2

text: Shouting something in a guttural language neither understood, the orc charged.
Name: Book 2

text: Get back, Harruq ordered as he shoved Qurrah to one side.
Name: Book 2

text: He slammed himself against a house, barely dodging a downward chop of the blades.
Name: Book 2

text: The orc attacked again, all his strength behind the swing.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq ducked, narrowly avoiding decapitation.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah lunged before the orc could strike again, latching onto his wrist and letting dark magic flow.
Name: Book 2

text: The orc howled at the sensation of a hundred scorpions stinging his flesh.
Name: Book 2

text: Flooded with adrenaline, he hurled Qurrah aside, desperate to break the contact between them.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrahs thin body crumpled against the dirt.
Name: Book 2

text: At the sight of it, Harruq felt his rage break loose.
Name: Book 2

text: He slammed his fist into the orcs stomach, followed by a brutal kick to the groin.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq rammed his elbows into the orcs face, baring his teeth in a feral grin as he felt cartilage crunch.
Name: Book 2

text: Staggering back, the orc dropped one of his swords and clutched his face.
Name: Book 2

text: His sword, Qurrah shouted loud as he could.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq obeyed without thought.
Name: Book 2

text: He dropped to his knees, grabbed the sword, and rolled forward.
Name: Book 2

text: Steel smacked where he had been.
Name: Book 2

text: Now on his back, Harruq tossed the sword in front of himself, clutching the hilt with both hands.
Name: Book 2

text: The orc smashed his own blade downward, and as they connected, Harruq did not feel fear or the strain of his muscles.
Name: Book 2

text: Even though the orc pressed with all his strength, he could not force the kill.
Name: Book 2

text: At last, Harruq forced him back, and in the brief opening he spun his sword around and buried half the blade into the orcs gut.
Name: Book 2

text: The orc gasped something unintelligible, dropped his other sword, and fell limp.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq stared at the body, his hands shaking from the excitement and his breath thunderous in his ears.
Name: Book 2

text: A hand touched his shoulder.
Name: Book 2

text: He recoiled as if struck.
Name: Book 2

text: Well done, Qurrah said, his eyes locked on the corpse.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq recognized that look.
Name: Book 2

text: His brother had seen something he wanted, and he would have it.
Name: Book 2

text: A strong life and a fresh death.
Name: Book 2

text: Even as they stood there, he watched several orcs go running past, howling murder.
Name: Book 2

text: We will partake in our own way, Qurrah said, kneeling beside the orc.
Name: Book 2

text: The savage clutched his stomach, his hands the only thing holding in his innards.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrahs thin, ashen face curled into a sneer.
Name: Book 2

text: Perhaps his brother would think him weak, but he would not watch.
Name: Book 2

text: He heard a sudden shriek of pain that morphed into a long, drawn-out moan.
Name: Book 2

text: As the last of the air left the orcs lungs, Harruq turned around, startled by the sight.
Name: Book 2

text: Beauty in all things, Qurrah said, purple light dancing across his face.
Name: Book 2

text: Especially those things that are controlled.
Name: Book 2

text: An orb floated above his open palm, seemingly made of thick, violet smoke.
Name: Book 2

text: Within its center, a face shifted, its sunken eyes glaring.
Name: Book 2

text: When it opened its mouth, no sound came forth, just a soft puff of ash.
Name: Book 2

text: A soul seeking release, Qurrah said.
Name: Book 2

text: How destructive, I wonder.
Name: Book 2

text: Get rid of it, Harruq said as he picked up the other sword the orc had dropped.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah asked, his delight vanishing into a sudden frown.
Name: Book 2

text: He thought to explain and then just shrugged.
Name: Book 2

text: It makes me uneasy, he said instead.
Name: Book 2

text: But do as you wish.
Name: Book 2

text: The frailer brother approached the end of the alley where the sound of combat was strongest.
Name: Book 2

text: His steps faltered only once.
Name: Book 2

text: When Harruq moved to catch him, Qurrah glared and leaned against the side of a house.
Name: Book 2

text: When a luckless orc rushed too close to the exit, Qurrah hurled the orb.
Name: Book 2

text: Its explosion conjured shadows and shifting mists of violets and purples.
Name: Book 2

text: The orc collapsed, white smoke rising softly from his tongue.
Name: Book 2

text: In the sudden blinding light, Qurrah laughed.
Name: Book 2

text: Never, he said, could I have imagined it so beautiful.
Name: Book 2

text: An hour before dawn, the citys soldiers cornered and killed the last of the orcs.
Name: Book 2

text: The Tun brothers were not there to watch, for they had snuck back to the outer wall at Qurrahs insistence.
Name: Book 2

text: I know his plans, Qurrah whispered as they stared across the open grass and the arrow-pierced orc bodies that covered it.
Name: Book 2

text: He is familiar to me, though I know him not.
Name: Book 2

text: He isnt your former master, is he.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq asked as he adjusted his newly acquired swords.
Name: Book 2

text: He had taken a belt and some sheathes from one of the dead bodies, but he was having a devil of a time getting them to fit correctly.
Name: Book 2

text: Whoever this is, he is someone else.
Name: Book 2

text: He pointed into the darkness.
Name: Book 2

text: Robed in black, the figure approached unseen by the guards.
Name: Book 2

text: He lifted his hands, which shone a pallid white in the fading moonlight.
Name: Book 2

text: So very slowly their color faded, from white, to gray, to nothing, a darkness surrounding and hiding them.
Name: Book 2

text: He pulled one of his swords out from its sheath, pleased by the feeling of confidence it gave him.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah said not a word.
Name: Book 2

text: His eyes were far away, and his lips moved but produced no sound.
Name: Book 2

text: He struck his brother on the arm.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah jolted as if suddenly waking.
Name: Book 2

text: The dead, Qurrah said.
Name: Book 2

text: Sure enough, the arrow-ridden bodies stirred.
Name: Book 2

text: As if of one mind, they rose together, ignoring any injuries upon them.
Name: Book 2

text: Some hobbled on broken legs while others shambled with twisted and mangled arms.
Name: Book 2

text: The brothers watched as hundreds more lumbered through the still-broken southern gate.
Name: Book 2

text: A few belated alarms cried out from the exhausted guards, but they were too few and too late.
Name: Book 2

text: Unencumbered, the horde of dead marched out to where the necromancer extended his arms to embrace them.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq and Qurrah watched until the sun rose in the east and all trace of the necromancer vanished.
Name: Book 2

text: What is it he wanted.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq asked, breaking their long silence.
Name: Book 2

text: More dead for his army, Qurrah surmised.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah nodded, knowing he disrespected his brother to think he might not have noticed.
Name: Book 2

text: He wanted my name, Qurrah said.
Name: Book 2

text: I did not give it.
Name: Book 2

text: I have served a master once.
Name: Book 2

text: I will not do so again.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq frowned but said no more.
Name: Book 2

text: Together they climbed down from the wall and returned home.
Name: Book 2

text: Home to the two half-orcs was in the older, mostly abandoned southern district of Veldaren.
Name: Book 2

text: Those with wealth had drifted northeast, closer to the castle and away from the busy streets and markets.
Name: Book 2

text: When King Vaelor had ordered all trade to come in through the western gate, and not the south, it had been the final nail in the districts coffin.
Name: Book 2

text: The homeless, hungry, and destitute flooded the rows of abandoned buildings, clawing them away from their legal owners with their very presence, or sometimes their murders.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq and Qurrah played that game well.
Name: Book 2

text: They had grown up on the streets of Veldaren and fought for every scrap of food theyd eaten.
Name: Book 2

text: They had punched and kicked for every soft, dry bed.
Name: Book 2

text: Then, one day, they finally killed.
Name: Book 2

text: A fine home is any home thats yours, Harruq said as he forced back a couple planks sealing a window.
Name: Book 2

text: Aint that right, Qurrah.
Name: Book 2

text: Once the window was unblocked, the two climbed in.
Name: Book 2

text: They lived in what had once been a large shed.
Name: Book 2

text: The door was still boarded shut, but the window, well.
Name: Book 2

text: For two such as they, windows worked as well as doors.
Name: Book 2

text: They sat diagonally of each other so they had room to stretch their legs.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq unhooked his belt and placed his swords in a corner, brushing their hilts against his fingertips.
Name: Book 2

text: I want to learn how to use them, he said.
Name: Book 2

text: Think anyone will teach me.
Name: Book 2

text: Youll find plenty wholl teach you how to die by one, he said.
Name: Book 2

text: Im not sure about the other way around.
Name: Book 2

text: His mind kept replaying the fight with the orc.
Name: Book 2

text: Untrained and unprepared, he had still won.
Name: Book 2

text: What could he accomplish with training.
Name: Book 2

text: How many might fear him if he had skill to match his strength and steel to match his anger.
Name: Book 2

text: I know of a way, Qurrah said, pulling at one of many loose strands of his robes.
Name: Book 2

text: A way for you to practice.
Name: Book 2

text: You saw what I did with that dead body.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq nodded, disturbed by the hungry look in Qurrahs eyes.
Name: Book 2

text: I did, he said, and it scared the abyss out of me.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah dismissed this with a wave of his hand.
Name: Book 2

text: With exposure comes understanding.
Name: Book 2

text: I am always in control, so dont fear what I do.
Name: Book 2

text: But I must learn, Harruq.
Name: Book 2

text: I have no school, no teacher, nothing but scattered memories of my wretched master when I was nine.
Name: Book 2

text: Nevertheless, deathdeath has a way of teaching us things.
Name: Book 2

text: I can sense its power so clearly in its presence.
Name: Book 2

text: You must give it to me.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq crossed his arms and stared into the corner.
Name: Book 2

text: People die every day here, he said.
Name: Book 2

text: Shall I find their bodies and bring them to you.
Name: Book 2

text: For now, Qurrah said.
Name: Book 2

text: If the death is fresh, the power should still linger.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq reached out, grabbed his brothers wrist, and clasped his hands in his.
Name: Book 2

text: I wont like it, he said.
Name: Book 2

text: But Ill do it for you.
Name: Book 2

text: We are better than them, Qurrah said, standing so he could look through the cracks of the boards across the broken door.
Name: Book 2

text: Life is for those who take it.
Name: Book 2

text: I need you to understand this, brother.
Name: Book 2

text: Together, we can become something great.
Name: Book 2

text: What can we become.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrahs eyes twinkled, but he said not a word.
Name: Book 2

text: Guard captain Antonil marched through the street, leading fifty of his men marching in perfect union.
Name: Book 2

text: His face was a portrait of stoic calm, but it was all a lie.
Name: Book 2

text: His heart was troubled and he had not a soul to tell why.
Name: Book 2

text: He held a proclamation of King Vaelor to the entire nation of Neldar.
Name: Book 2

text: He had argued as best he could, but his words meant little.
Name: Book 2

text: When Antonil asked that someone else deliver the proclamation, a frown had crossed the kings smooth face and he had slammed his lotioned hand against a table.
Name: Book 2

text: It will mean more coming from you.
Name: Book 2

text: the king had shouted.
Name: Book 2

text: They will know the seriousness of my order.
Name: Book 2

text: I will not be flooded with spies, treated like a mere peasant, and then insulted by such blatant snubbing of my humble call for aid.
Name: Book 2

text: Let them know I am king, my dear Antonil.
Name: Book 2

text: Make sure they know.
Name: Book 2

text: Antonil halted at the center of Veldaren where the four main roads of the city interconnected and a large marble fountain towered over all.
Name: Book 2

text: Not bothering to call for silence or attention, he unrolled the scroll and shouted its edict.
Name: Book 2

text: Because of his rank, the troops in attendance, and the overall respect given to the man who had engineered the citys successful defense only days before, he was quickly given a respectful silence.
Name: Book 2

text: By order of the King, all elves are to be removed from Neldar lands.
Name: Book 2

text: They shall not travel within our cities, live in our settlements, or trade with our people.
Name: Book 2

text: They are banned in all possible sense of the word.
Name: Book 2

text: They have abandoned us, so let us abandon them.
Name: Book 2

text: These are the words of your King, Edwin Vaelor, and may they never be forgotten.
Name: Book 2

text: Antonil closed the scroll and then nodded for his soldiers to return to their post.
Name: Book 2

text: Holding in a curse, he headed to the royal stables.

text: He needed to speak with Dieredon and personally break the terrible news.

text: Qurrah smirked as the guard captain hurried away.

text: Elves banned, he said to his brother.

text: Only handfuls live within these walls, and they are just diplomats and messengers.

text: Our king is a spiteful, paranoid one.

text: He was large, well-muscled, and scratching at a long beard that stretched down to his belt.

text: In a massive voice, he shouted to the mulling throngs.

text: The royal guard is in need of able-bodied men to help rebuild the walls of the city, he shouted.

text: The work will be hard, but we offer a threepence of copper a day.

text: Come to the castle and ask for Alvrik.

text: Take the workif theyll take you.

text: Thanks, he mumbled and hurried off.

text: Never before had he done anything like this.

text: He didnt hear the reasons why and didnt want to know.

text: The idea of so much money, more than enough to buy warm food and clean drink, kept him there.
Name: Book 2

text: At last it was his turn, and he approached the table where Alvrik sat chewing on a piece of bone long since void of meat.

text: Well, Harruq, Alvrik said, slowly nodding his head.

text: Jeremiah Stoutmire walked through the village of Cornrows, the hair on his neck erect.

text: The body of Ahrqur Tundel lay atop several strange markings and shapes drawn in the dirt.

text: The mood in Woodhaven grew somber as dark rumors spread.

text: Everyone knew why but none spoke of it, at least outside of a whisper.

text: Behind him, the tents of his soldiers, numbering more than six hundred, lay scattered about in loose formation.

text: He will listen to me; he always has.
Name: Book 2

text: Velixar shook his head and pointed toward Woodhaven in the far distance.
Name: Book 2

text: Back there he left you, and I must punish him for suchQurrah, look to the sky.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah followed Velixars gaze, and there in the distance he saw many white objects faintly illuminated by the stars.
Name: Book 2

text: About a hundred, Qurrah said.
Name: Book 2

text: But what are they.
Name: Book 2

text: Elves, the man in black said.
Name: Book 2

text: And I know who leads them.
Name: Book 2

text: Prepare yourself, my disciple.
Name: Book 2

text: I have erred, and now we pay the price.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah nodded, then closed his eyes and rehearsed the spells he knew.
Name: Book 2

text: They were weak compared to his masters but they would claim a few lives.
Name: Book 2

text: His whip curled around his arm, ready for more bloodshed.
Name: Book 2

text: The white dots in the distance grew at a frightening rate.
Name: Book 2

text: Such speed, Qurrah said.
Name: Book 2

text: They are the Ekreissar, Velixar answered.
Name: Book 2

text: The Quellan elite are the only ones capable of raising and flying the winged horses.
Name: Book 2

text: When they fly in, stay low, and aim your spells for their horses.
Name: Book 2

text: The rider will die from the fall.
Name: Book 2

text: The man in black closed his eyes and spoke to the undead surrounding them.
Name: Book 2

text: Hide our presence, he ordered.
Name: Book 2

text: Spread about, and do not halt your movement for all eternity.
Name: Book 2

text: The two thousand obeyed, scattering in a constantly moving jumble of arms and legs.
Name: Book 2

text: That should help keep our presence hidden for a time, Qurrah said.
Name: Book 2

text: They are but distractions.
Name: Book 2

text: The darkness will hide us from their arrows.
Name: Book 2

text: Before Qurrah could ask what Velixar meant, his master was already in the midst of another spell.
Name: Book 2

text: Inky darkness rose all about his feet, swirling like black floodwaters.
Name: Book 2

text: Chills crept up his ankles as the liquid darkness grew.
Name: Book 2

text: Velixar cried out the final words of the spell, spreading the darkness for a mile in all directions, so high it covered up to their necks.
Name: Book 2

text: It is cold, Qurrah said, his teeth chattering.
Name: Book 2

text: You will not be harmed by it, Velixar said, watching the approaching army.
Name: Book 2

text: With so much hidden, they will be hard pressed to target us among my undead.
Name: Book 2

text: What should we do.
Name: Book 2

text: one elf shouted above the wind roaring past their ears.
Name: Book 2

text: Unleash our arrows, Dieredon shouted back.
Name: Book 2

text: Watch for the necromancer.
Name: Book 2

text: Ignore the undead once you locate him.
Name: Book 2

text: The blasphemous blanket of darkness stretched out below them like a great fog, filled with bobbing heads of Velixars army.
Name: Book 2

text: In that chaotic mass, Dieredon knew the man in black would remain well hidden.
Name: Book 2

text: Not until enough of the undead had been massacred.
Name: Book 2

text: He readied his bow, his strong legs the only thing holding him to Sonowin.
Name: Book 2

text: Three arrows pressed against the string of the bow, their tips dipped in holy water.
Name: Book 2

text: His quiver, as was the quiver of every elf flying alongside him, contained water given to them by their clerics of Celestia.
Name: Book 2

text: When their arrows bit into dead flesh, it would be like fire on a dry leaf.
Name: Book 2

text: Let no life lost this night be in vain.
Name: Book 2

text: Dieredon cried as they descended like a white river, raining arrows into the darkness.
Name: Book 2

text: More than two hundred moving forms halted after that one pass, but a thousand more swayed in their sick, distracting dance.
Name: Book 2

text: One free pass, Velixar said, observing the flight of elves as they swarmed overhead.
Name: Book 2

text: They banked around, still in perfect formation, and then dove again.
Name: Book 2

text: Kill them now.
Name: Book 2

text: he ordered, his fingers crooking into strange shapes.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah hissed, pointing at the nearest horse.
Name: Book 2

text: Blood ruptured from the beautiful creatures neck.
Name: Book 2

text: The rider steadied her best he could, knowing his doom approached.
Name: Book 2

text: They crashed into the inky blackness, crushing bodies underneath before the swarming dead tore them to pieces.
Name: Book 2

text: Velixars first attack was far more impressive.
Name: Book 2

text: Bits of bone ripped out from his undead army; femurs, fingers, ribs, and teeth flew into the sky in a deadly assault.
Name: Book 2

text: The elves broke formation as the barrage approached.
Name: Book 2

text: The first ten, however, were too close to have hope.
Name: Book 2

text: Bone shredded wings and scattered feathers.
Name: Book 2

text: The elves that were alive when their horses landed died by the clawing hands of rotted flesh.
Name: Book 2

text: Dieredon looped in the sky, his confidence shaken at the sight of so many of his dying friends.
Name: Book 2

text: He fired arrows three at a time, his quiver never approaching empty.
Name: Book 2

text: He ordered Sonowin lower, shouting out the command as another barrage of bone pelted four more elves to their deaths.
Name: Book 2

text: Skimming above the darkness, Dieredon fired volley after volley behind him.
Name: Book 2

text: When they were past the undead, he pulled Sonowin high into the air to observe the battlefield.
Name: Book 2

text: The ranks of the undead were half of what they had been, yet still he could not see the lowered black hood he so badly needed to see.
Name: Book 2

text: Come, Sonowin, we will find him, even if it means killing every last one of his puppets.
Name: Book 2

text: The horse neighed and dove, spurred on by the sight of its own kind falling in death.
Name: Book 2

text: Behind you, master, Qurrah said.
Name: Book 2

text: He hurried the words of a spell as Velixar turned.
Name: Book 2

text: An incorporeal hand shot from Qurrahs own, flying across the battlefield to where an elf dove toward them, arrows flashing two at a time in the starlight.
Name: Book 2

text: The hand struck the elf in the chest, freezing flesh and eviscerating his insides with ice.
Name: Book 2

text: The flying horse banked upward as its master fell limp into the fog.
Name: Book 2

text: Beautiful, Qurrah, Velixar said, bloodlust burning in his red eyes.
Name: Book 2

text: His precious undead were being massacred.
Name: Book 2

text: He could feel their numbers dwindling in his mind, now but a third of what his glorious army had been.
Name: Book 2

text: This has gone on long enough, he seethed.
Name: Book 2

text: He outstretched his hands and shrieked words of magic.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah staggered back, in awe of the power that came rolling forth.
Name: Book 2

text: The fog of darkness swirled and recoiled at each word Velixar spoke.
Name: Book 2

text: The cold on his flesh grew sharper as the blackness grew thicker.
Name: Book 2

text: Be gone from me.
Name: Book 2

text: Velixar cried, yanking down his arms.
Name: Book 2

text: Six fingered hands ripped up from the black, some smaller than a childs, some as large as houses.
Name: Book 2

text: Each one lunged to the sky, clutching and grabbing at the elves that circled above.
Name: Book 2

text: Retreat.
Name: Book 2

text: one elf shouted, banking as black fingers tore through the air just before his mount.
Name: Book 2

text: Another screamed as a hundred tiny hands enveloped him, crushing the life from his body.
Name: Book 2

text: Dieredon clutched Sonowins neck as a hand the size of a tree swung open-palmed at him.
Name: Book 2

text: Sonowin spun, diving closer to the darkness and underneath the giant hand.
Name: Book 2

text: Cries of pain filled the night as more and more elves fell to the reaching black magic.
Name: Book 2

text: Dieredon held on tight, trusting his life to Sonowin.
Name: Book 2

text: He scanned the battlefield while they whirled up and down, over one hand and then dancing away from another.
Name: Book 2

text: Just as Sonowin pulled higher and higher into the air, outracing more than seven growing hands reaching up for them, the elf spotted two lone figures amid the sea of dead.
Name: Book 2

text: Sonowin, he shouted to his steed.
Name: Book 2

text: There, you must get to them.
Name: Book 2

text: The horse snorted, banked around, and dove straight for the approaching hands.
Name: Book 2

text: A quick spiral avoided the first wave.
Name: Book 2

text: Dieredon clutched his bow and held on for dear life, his eyes locking on the man in black who stood perfectly still, his arms at downward angles from his body.
Name: Book 2

text: The rest of the elves were in full retreat.
Name: Book 2

text: He was the only one left.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah watched Dieredons approach with a gnawing fear in his chest.
Name: Book 2

text: It seemed no hand could touch this one, the horse possessing dexterity beyond what any creature that size should have.
Name: Book 2

text: Velixar showed no sign of being aware of their approach.
Name: Book 2

text: His eyes had rolled back into his head as he controlled the multitude of magical hands.
Name: Book 2

text: Be gone, Qurrah said, firing several pieces of bone.
Name: Book 2

text: He tried to cast another hemorrhage spell but the words felt heavy and drunk on his tongue.
Name: Book 2

text: His mind ached, his chest heaved, and when the spell finished it created nothing but a wound the size of an arrowhead in the side of Sonowin.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah shouted as loud as he could.
Name: Book 2

text: More and more hands curled in, surrounding Dieredon and Sonowin in a magical maelstrom, yet still they came.
Name: Book 2

text: Fly, Sonowin, the elf shouted.
Name: Book 2

text: Dieredon leapt from Sonowins back, the blades on his bow gleaming.
Name: Book 2

text: He fell through the air, the long spike on the bottom aimed directly for Velixars head.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah shouted again, shoving his body against Velixars.
Name: Book 2

text: His concentration broken, Velixar lost his control of the black fog.
Name: Book 2

text: The darkness swirled inward as if Velixar were the center of a giant drain.
Name: Book 2

text: The blackness filled him, surrounded him, and consumed him.
Name: Book 2

text: When all returned, and Dieredon was about to land, a wave of pure sound and energy rippled outward.
Name: Book 2

text: Velixar was waking, and he was angry.
Name: Book 2

text: The wave sent Qurrah crashing against a giant undead man still wearing rusted platemail.
Name: Book 2

text: The collision blasted the air from his lungs.
Name: Book 2

text: When he hit the ground, stars filled his vision.
Name: Book 2

text: Dieredon fought but could not resist that same wave of power.
Name: Book 2

text: The point of his blade halted a foot from the top of the black hood before he flew back.
Name: Book 2

text: In the distance, Qurrah watched his master glaring at the damned elf who had fallen like a mad man.
Name: Book 2

text: Scoutmaster, Velixar growled, his voice deep and dark like an ancient daemon of old.
Name: Book 2

text: Twice you have looked upon me and lived.
Name: Book 2

text: Dieredon twirled his bow, his face calm and emotionless.
Name: Book 2

text: Too many have died at your hand.
Name: Book 2

text: What life you have ends tonight.
Name: Book 2

text: Velixar roared, a sound that made Qurrah shiver and avert his eyes.
Name: Book 2

text: His masters back was to him, so he could not see the face that Dieredon saw, which was full of rotted skin and crawling, feasting things.
Name: Book 2

text: Suddenly Dieredon pulled back.
Name: Book 2

text: The blades in his bow snapped inward.
Name: Book 2

text: Arrows cannot hurt me, Velixar mocked.
Name: Book 2

text: They did not the first time.
Name: Book 2

text: Why do you hope so now.
Name: Book 2

text: Because these arrows are different.
Name: Book 2

text: He fired three at once, all burying deep into Velixars chest.
Name: Book 2

text: The man in black screamed as the sacred water burned his skin.
Name: Book 2

text: He fell to one knee and vomited a pile of white flesh and maggots.
Name: Book 2

text: You will suffer, he gasped.
Name: Book 2

text: For ages, I will make you suffer.
Name: Book 2

text: Try it, said Dieredon.
Name: Book 2

text: Two more arrows flew, but they halted in mid-air.
Name: Book 2

text: Velixar stood, his hand outstretched, gripping the projectiles with his mind.
Name: Book 2

text: The elf fired two more volleys but all the arrows froze beside the others.
Name: Book 2

text: At once, the arrows turned and resumed their flight, straight at Dieredon.
Name: Book 2

text: The elf dove, rolling underneath the barrage.
Name: Book 2

text: Not an arrow had hit earth before the elf tucked his feet and kicked.
Name: Book 2

text: The blades sprang from his bow.
Name: Book 2

text: He crossed the distance between the two in a heartbeat.
Name: Book 2

text: Velixar accepted a stab deep into his chest.
Name: Book 2

text: A pale hand grabbed Dieredons throat, its grip iron and its flesh ice.
Name: Book 2

text: It will be painful, Velixar said.
Name: Book 2

text: Vile magic swirled about his hand, pouring into Dieredons neck.
Name: Book 2

text: The blood in his veins clotted and thickened.
Name: Book 2

text: A toss of his hand and the elf flew through the air.
Name: Book 2

text: He rolled across the ground without the usual grace he had shown in combat.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah glanced about, paralyzed with fear.
Name: Book 2

text: The remaining elves were returning, deadly and furious, and the darkness that had protected them was gone.
Name: Book 2

text: Do you feel it.
Name: Book 2

text: Velixar said, stalking over to the dying elf.
Name: Book 2

text: The blood in your throat is clotting.
Name: Book 2

text: Your mind will starve and your heart will burst trying to force blood through.
Name: Book 2

text: He knew he should speak.
Name: Book 2

text: He had to warn master.
Name: Book 2

text: But he could not open his mouth.
Name: Book 2

text: He could not move.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 2

text: The pegasi were closer.
Name: Book 2

text: They were readying their bows.
Name: Book 2

text: He had to speak.
Name: Book 2

text: Can you feel it.
Name: Book 2

text: the man in black asked.
Name: Book 2

text: Can you feel your heart shudder and throb.
Name: Book 2

text: Here, let me help your pain.
Name: Book 2

text: Dieredon lay on his back, staring up at him.
Name: Book 2

text: His chest was a mess of pain, his mind light and dizzy.
Name: Book 2

text: As Velixar reached down, his maggoty face smiling and his hand dripping unholy magic, a wave of arrows rained upon him.
Name: Book 2

text: Five buried into Velixars back.
Name: Book 2

text: Six more found his legs and arms.
Name: Book 2

text: He arched and shrieked as the blessed water seared his wretched body.
Name: Book 2

text: Dieredon staggered to his feet, his bow still in his hands.
Name: Book 2

text: The man in black reached around and tore out the arrows from his body.
Name: Book 2

text: Still no blood flowed.
Name: Book 2

text: My name is Dieredon, the elf gasped.
Name: Book 2

text: Know it before I send you to the abyss.
Name: Book 2

text: He fired two arrows, one for each eye.
Name: Book 2

text: They shattered into fire, and finally blood did flow.
Name: Book 2

text: It ran down the dead flesh and bone that was his face, over his black robes, and pooled in the grass below.
Name: Book 2

text: He fell prone, still screaming his anger and fury.
Name: Book 2

text: For five hundred years he had walked the land of Dezrel.
Name: Book 2

text: All that time, all those killings, and this was how he would fail.
Name: Book 2

text: Karak.
Name: Book 2

text: he shouted, all his power fleeing him.
Name: Book 2

text: His undead minions collapsed, their souls released.
Name: Book 2

text: The gates to the abyss opened before his eyes, and he felt the pull on his soul.
Name: Book 2

text: The dark fire already burned.
Name: Book 2

text: He saw the face of his master, and the sick grin there horrified him.
Name: Book 2

text: I will not die.
Name: Book 2

text: he shrieked.
Name: Book 2

text: I will not die.
Name: Book 2

text: His flesh burned in fire, his bones blew away as dust on the wind, and only an empty robe remained of the being that was Velixar.
Name: Book 2

text: Yet, still haunting the wind, was his final cry, a promise to the world of Dezrel.
Name: Book 2

text: I will not die.
Name: Book 2

text: * Chapter 17 Chapter 17{{{1 17.
Name: Book 2

text: Miles away, Harruq awoke screaming.
Name: Book 2

text: Aurelia rushed to his side as he curled into a ball, shuddering frantically.
Name: Book 2

text: Hes dead, he said.
Name: Book 2

text: Cold sweat covered his body.
Name: Book 2

text: Remnants of his nightmare floated before his eyes, the icy voice of Velixar rolling over him in his vengeful fury.
Name: Book 2

text: All hed known, all hed ever loved, was dead and gone.
Name: Book 2

text: Only Karak had remained, furious at the loss.
Name: Book 2

text: Through it all, one single fact pulsed as an undeniable truth.
Name: Book 2

text: Velixar, Harruq said, clutching Aurelias hands and sighing with a mixture of relief and terror.
Name: Book 2

text: Aurelia kissed his forehead as the half-orc drifted back to sleep, still overcome with his exhaustion.
Name: Book 2

text: To her eyes, it seemed he slept far better than he had before.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah did not know what to say or do as he watched his master die.
Name: Book 2

text: His entire world had just come crashing down in the darkness.
Name: Book 2

text: Above him were more than fifty elves, each one eager to bury an arrow in his back.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq, he said, crawling amid the bodies.
Name: Book 2

text: He desperately hoped none would spot him.
Name: Book 2

text: He reached a large stinking corpse lying on its back with a golden arrow in its forehead.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah shoved the cadaver onto its side, curled underneath, and then let it fall atop him.
Name: Book 2

text: The weight crushed his fragile body and the smell was awful, but it was his only cover.
Name: Book 2

text: Miserable, he hid there, quietly whispering.
Name: Book 2

text: Where are you, Harruq.
Name: Book 2

text: he said, his face buried into the dirt.
Name: Book 2

text: His tears fell to the grass.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq, I need you.
Name: Book 2

text: Then he heard talking and shut his mouth.
Name: Book 2

text: Are you alright, Dieredon.
Name: Book 2

text: an elf asked.
Name: Book 2

text: The scoutmaster nodded, leaning heavily on his bow.
Name: Book 2

text: I will be fine.
Name: Book 2

text: His magic left my body upon his death.
Name: Book 2

text: A neigh brought his attention upward.
Name: Book 2

text: Sonowin landed next to him, her white hair stained red in places.
Name: Book 2

text: She nuzzled the elf and snorted something.
Name: Book 2

text: You worry too much, old girl, Dieredon said, his voice cracking several times.
Name: Book 2

text: He patted her once and then turned to the elf standing nearby.
Name: Book 2

text: How many did we lose.
Name: Book 2

text: We paid dearly to kill this man.
Name: Book 2

text: A heavy price, Dieredon said, gingerly climbing atop Sonowin.
Name: Book 2

text: Heavy, but well worth its weight in blood.
Name: Book 2

text: A great evil has left this land.
Name: Book 2

text: Let us return to Woodhaven, for this place of death turns my mouth sour.
Name: Book 2

text: The two took to the air and joined the other survivors.
Name: Book 2

text: They did not try to locate their dead among the hundreds of other rotting bodies.
Name: Book 2

text: Instead, a few elves flew low and scattered firestones, small pebbles that burst into flame upon landing.
Name: Book 2

text: Grass and bodies ignited, and the battlefield rapidly swelled into a giant funeral pyre.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah crawled out from underneath the body as flames erupted all around him.
Name: Book 2

text: Everywhere he looked, he saw embers and corpses.
Name: Book 2

text: He spotted the robes of Velixar and ran to them.
Name: Book 2

text: He picked them up and shook them, furious that no body remained.
Name: Book 2

text: You lied to me, Velixar, Qurrah said.
Name: Book 2

text: You said you were eternal.
Name: Book 2

text: You said you held the power of a god.
Name: Book 2

text: You are nothing but dust.
Name: Book 2

text: Surrounded by fire and death, the half-orc stripped naked of his rags and donned the robes of his former master.
Name: Book 2

text: Despite all the arrows and heat, they seemed in perfect condition.
Name: Book 2

text: Even the stain of blood was already fading.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah held the side of the hood to his mouth and coughed as the smoke grew ever thicker.
Name: Book 2

text: Goodbye, Velixar, he said.
Name: Book 2

text: Then he chose a direction and staggered away.
Name: Book 2

text: Slowly, and with a few wide curves through the carnage, he found a way out.
Name: Book 2

text: He huddled the black robes tighter about his thin body, relishing the soft feel and perfect fit.
Name: Book 2

text: Smoke clogged his lungs, but the stinking waves of it were lessening the farther he walked.
Name: Book 2

text: Where are you, brother.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah asked once he could breathe freely.
Name: Book 2

text: In the dark before the dawn, it seemed he would receive no answer.
Name: Book 2

text: At last, he could travel no more.
Name: Book 2

text: He had no food, no destination, and no company.
Name: Book 2

text: His limbs were weak and his head throbbed.
Name: Book 2

text: To his knees he slumped, and he let time pass and his strength return, while his mind rummaged for ideas of how to proceed.
Name: Book 2

text: While the sun was still a sliver peeking over the horizon, Aurelia shook Harruqs shoulders to wake him.
Name: Book 2

text: She then sat back and put her hands to her forehead while the half-orc tried to remember where he was.
Name: Book 2

text: Can you find him.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq asked her, realizing what she was doing.
Name: Book 2

text: He sat on his rear and began readjusting his armor to his more slender frame.
Name: Book 2

text: In time, she said.
Name: Book 2

text: I have met him only once, but I doubt there are any like him.
Name: Book 2

text: Stay quiet and be patient.
Name: Book 2

text: Her mind was a net, and she cast it further and further out, scanning the rolling hills and the plains beyond.
Name: Book 2

text: Found him, she whispered.
Name: Book 2

text: A blue portal ripped through the air before Qurrah, beckoning him.
Name: Book 2

text: He looked through but saw only mists and distorted landscape.
Name: Book 2

text: Seeing nothing to lose, he got to his feet and stepped inside.
Name: Book 2

text: He felt the sensation of traveling a great distance yet his mind insisted he had taken only a single step.
Name: Book 2

text: He could see the orange glow of the great pyre several miles away.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq cried, wrapping him in a hug.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah endured it, keeping his hands at his sides.
Name: Book 2

text: I was so worried about you.
Name: Book 2

text: Velixar is dead, Qurrah said, eyeing Aurelia warily.
Name: Book 2

text: We know, the elf said.
Name: Book 2

text: It is well to meet you again, Qurrah.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah stepped back from his brother, and Aurelia noticed his robes and frowned.
Name: Book 2

text: You should have left them.
Name: Book 2

text: He was an evil man.
Name: Book 2

text: Following in his footsteps will lead to a similar fate.
Name: Book 2

text: The half-orc said nothing.
Name: Book 2

text: For a moment all three glanced about, the atmosphere akin to air before a thunderstorm.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah broke the silence.
Name: Book 2

text: Woodhaven is behind us, he said.
Name: Book 2

text: I have made mistakes, as has my brother.
Name: Book 2

text: I saw you leave with him, and I know you sacrificed much to protect him.
Name: Book 2

text: For this, I thank you.
Name: Book 2

text: All I ask is that we speak naught of this again.
Name: Book 2

text: If we are to travel together, it is my only wish.
Name: Book 2

text: A wish gladly granted, Aurelia said, a tiny smile finally cracking free.
Name: Book 2

text: So where is it we should go.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrah glanced at his brother and shrugged.
Name: Book 2

text: The only homes we have known are Woodhaven and Veldaren.
Name: Book 2

text: I doubt either will gladly accept us.
Name: Book 2

text: I have never been to Veldaren, Aurelia said.
Name: Book 2

text: Although I have heard it is beautiful, in its own way.
Name: Book 2

text: I can get us inside, if all you fear are the gate guards.
Name: Book 2

text: The edict to banish elves is foolish, anyway.
Name: Book 2

text: After the casualties he took in Woodhaven, the king should be forced to revoke it lest any human villages be attacked.
Name: Book 2

text: I wouldnt mind going back home, Harruq said.
Name: Book 2

text: Sound good to you, Qurrah.
Name: Book 2

text: Wherever you two go, I will follow, he answered.
Name: Book 2

text: Settled then, Aurelia said.
Name: Book 2

text: You two are going to have to play along when we get there, though.
Name: Book 2

text: She glanced at the sky, which was still speckled with stars even though dawn fast approached.
Name: Book 2

text: Well wait until morning.
Name: Book 2

text: I could use a bit more sleep.
Name: Book 2

text: She walked away, cast a levitation spell upon herself, and then settled in for sleep hovering an inch above the grass.
Name: Book 2

text: Odd girl, Qurrah whispered.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq forced a laugh.
Name: Book 2

text: To Qurrahs eyes, he looked exhausted, and the shrinking of his muscles was glaring.
Name: Book 2

text: Im sorry I left you there at Woodhaven, Harruq said.
Name: Book 2

text: And Im sorry you were alone when Velixar died.
Name: Book 2

text: How did it happen.
Name: Book 2

text: Elves came and attacked.
Name: Book 2

text: No apologies are necessary, Harruq.
Name: Book 2

text: No, its not all forgiven, he said, grabbing his brothers shoulders.
Name: Book 2

text: I can see it in your eyes.
Name: Book 2

text: I would have given anything to be there with you.
Name: Book 2

text: Qurrahs bloodshot eyes lost their rage and sorrow.
Name: Book 2

text: His voice lowered, as if he were afraid Aurelia would hear.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 2

text: You abandoned me for her.
Name: Book 2

text: You left me, still wounded and alone.
Name: Book 2

text: And I know what you did, brother.
Name: Book 2

text: You turned against Velixar.
Name: Book 2

text: You denied the gifts he gave you.
Name: Book 2

text: Hes gone, Harruq said.
Name: Book 2

text: And I want that strength no more.
Name: Book 2

text: We are not his slaves.
Name: Book 2

text: We were his disciples.
Name: Book 2

text: We were his weapons.
Name: Book 2

text: He glanced back at Aurelia and held back a curse.
Name: Book 2

text: Weapons, he said again, his voice an angry whisper.
Name: Book 2

text: If that is your belief, Qurrah said, settling down upon the grass.
Name: Book 2

text: But dont forget the blood on your hands.
Name: Book 2

text: You killed more than I, brother.
Name: Book 2

text: Now leave me be.
Name: Book 2

text: The night has been long, and I need to rest.
Name: Book 2

text: Harruq let Qurrah sleep in the flattened grass by the fireside.
Name: Book 2

text: As for him, he sat between Aurelia and Qurrah, glancing back and forth between the two.
Name: Book 2

text: I can love them both, he repeated, though seeing the robes Qurrah wore, he wondered how long before that love split to one or the other.
Name: Book 2

text: * Epilogue Epilogue{{{1 EPILOGUE.
Name: Book 2

text: Far away, ash floated on a cold breeze, sucked into a forgotten cavern within a chasm feared by orcs and goblins.
Name: Book 2

text: On the damp floor it fell, coalescing into a black muck, which stirred by unseen and unfelt winds.
Name: Book 2

text: Here a bone poked up from the filth, there a fingernail.
Name: Book 2

text: Floating above, transfixed in patient stasis, a soul awaiting a host, shone two crimson eyes.
Name: Book 2

text: * Note from the Author Note from the Author{{{1 A NOTE FROM THE AUTHOR.
Name: Book 2

text: I never set out to write a dark fantasy.
Name: Book 2

text: I had two characters in my head, troubled half-orcs without home or family and whose decisions would one day bathe a world with war.
Name: Book 2

text: To tell their story I had to start at the beginning, and the beginning is not kind.
Name: Book 2

text: Reading some letters and reviews, Ive seen just how dark Ive gone.
Name: Book 2

text: What you have just read is a slight alteration from my original manuscript.
Name: Book 2

text: I have not changed the brothers actions.
Name: Book 2

text: Instead, I have tried to show a bit more into their thoughts, their hearts, and their souls.
Name: Book 2

text: I have had people call Harruq and Qurrah evil.
Name: Book 2

text: Much of what they have done certainly is evil.
Name: Book 2

text: I will not sit here and justify the deaths of children, and to do so would paint me a psychopath and my characters sick beings.
Name: Book 2

text: I view Velixar as sort of a recruiter, the kind of man whod be right at home at a Nazi rally filling confused kids with bigotry, anger, and murder.
Name: Book 2

text: He is gone, for now anyway, and in The Cost of Betrayal these two brothers will get a chance to live on their own.
Name: Book 2

text: For once Harruq has not only felt regret but done something about it.
Name: Book 2

text: For once Qurrah has seen that the darkness he follows is not the absolute power it claims to be.
Name: Book 2

text: This Half-Orc Series is a story of redemption.
Name: Book 2

text: I will not tell it in just one book, not even in two or three.
Name: Book 2

text: People will die, and I will break the hearts of my beloved creations.
Name: Book 2

text: If youve read this far and enjoyed it, I welcome you to continue along with me, as well as thank you for your readership.
Name: Book 2

text: Your time is precious, dear reader, and I couldnt be happier knowing you spent it with me.
Name: Book 2

text: If youd like to email me for any reason, ask questions or give suggestions, you can contact me at [ddalglish@yahoo.
Name: Book 2

Name: Book 2

Name: Book 2

text: Hope you had fun.
Name: Book 2

text: Hope you were entertained.
Name: Book 2

text: Most of all, I hope for a brief moment you forgot your own world and got lost in mine.
Name: Book 2
